item.title: Jean Marco Rojas, a student at Instituto Tecnol√≥gico de Costa Rica, is running a survey to evaluate a possible new feature to #OSMTracker to upload traces to custom repositories and not only to #OpenStreetMap so that a mapping team will be able to manage their traces, for different purposes and later, if they consider it, upload them to OSM. https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf2JwrO8DczboSxewel3KIiafDDOpnfzd6VHhUtL-wTlv7KTg/viewform

Elements of a #Map. There are eight key elements that should be included each time a map is created in order to aid the viewer. If north arrow and scale bar pop to mind, you‚Äôd be right. What are the other six? https://www.gislounge.com/whats-in-a-map/
#OpenStreetMap Belgium‚Äôs Mapper of the Month #MotM goes back home to let us get to know Ivan Lievens from Belgium: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2022/07/01/ivan-lievens.html.

The OpenCage Blog interview series with #OpenStreetMap communities around the world is with Martijn van Exel @mvexel this time to hear all about OpenStreetMap in Utah: https://blog.opencagedata.com/post/openstreetmap-in-utah.
#OBS Project is looking to learn more about how you use OBS. As OBS Studio does not collect any telemetry, they‚Äôre reliant on users‚Äô direct feedback: https://obsproject.com/survey.

Osm Go! is looking for translators and developers. Osm Go! is a Android application and a Progressive Web Applications for contributing to #OpenStreetMap. https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Binnette/diary/399389 #osmgo
Where are the 10 closest airports near any point on the map? This fun web app gives the visual answer, powered by #OpenStreetMap data. https://willymaps.github.io/spoke/
State of the Map tickets and program now accessible at https://2022.stateofthemap.org/programme/. #OpenStreetMap #SotM #SotM22
Let‚Äôs head to Papua New Guinea to meet Nicxon Piaso, #OpenStreetMap Belgium‚Äôs Mapper of the Month #MotM: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2022/06/01/nicxon-piaso.html.

Pure luck, but also pure fun! My guess landed only 16km away from the üó∫Ô∏è #EOGuesser Daily Challenge target: https://s2maps.eu/eo-guesser/. Powered by #OpenStreetMap data. Via WeeklyOSM: https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/15627.

Blindly importing data into #OSM is a bad idea. #MapRoulette comes to the rescue, in this case for adding Microsoft‚Äôs machine-generated dataset of building footprints for the United States: https://ma.rtijn.org/2022/05/23/adding-microsoft-building-footprints-to-osm-with-maproulette-why-and-how.html. #OpenStreetMap

‚ÄúThe Streets of #Monaco‚Äù is a tutorial explaining how to extract Monaco's road network data from #OpenStreetMap, import it into #PostgreSQL and render it out using a tile server. It also shows how the #Formula1 circuit can be highlighted using #QGIS, an open source geospatial desktop application. https://tech.marksblogg.com/streets-of-monaco-openstreetmap-postgis-qgis.html

With the success of #PinJePunt campaign that created a massive add of notes, #OpenStreetMap Belgium organizes a #mapathon to resolve notes on Wednesday, June 1, 2022 evening: https://www.meetup.com/OpenStreetMap-Belgium/events/282711587/.

#ESP32 WiFiMulti connects to the strongest Wi-Fi network from a list of networks. It will connect to the Wi-Fi network with the strongest signal, and if the connection is lost, it will connect to the next network on the list. https://randomnerdtutorials.com/esp32-wifimulti/ #IoT

A 15 min. video #tutorial ‚ÄúHow to map buildings with #JOSM‚Äù: https://odysee.com/@BFS-OSM/how-to-map-buildings-with-josm. Learn how to boost your productivity by choosing the suitable methods between mapping buildings freehand, by snapping buildings together, or with the extract or subtraction tool. #OpenStreetMap
Sean Whitcomb shares his attention for the details and workflow for #micromapping Phoenix city parks at State of the Map US #SotM: https://yewtu.be/watch?v=zg6aLy_r630. #OpenStreetMap

While mapping in #OpenStreetMap, b-unicycling‚Äôs sharpened eye discovered an unlisted archeological site in Ireland from satellite imagery. You can read her story in her diary: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/b-unicycling/diary/399082. And listen to her excitement in her video report: https://yewtu.be/watch?v=b19C5O_tZE8. While you‚Äôre there you may want to follow her ‚ÄúOSM for History Buffs‚Äù channel. #archeology

And on a related note, talking of unexpected map viewers, I should also mention #MapSCII, which is a #Braille and ASCII world map renderer for your console, accessible via #telnet. Simply invoke ‚Äútelnet mapscii.me‚Äù. Powered by #OpenStreetMap data.

Retrospective interview with @pietervdvn on the partnership with Visit Flanders to augment #OpenStreetMap with points of interest for hikers and cyclists. https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/05/10/mapping-for-cyclists-and-hikers-flemish-tourism-organisations-join-forces-with-osm-belgium/ #pinjepunt

#CommotionMade lets you bulk find #Mastodon users by their handle: https://www.commotionmade.com. (Via: https://www.ilovefreesoftware.com/07/webware/free-website-to-bulk-find-and-follow-mastodon-users.html)
